pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body: Thanks @callesonne for your suggestions!

> Can I approve it after these changes? Or should I wait for someone more experienced to also review it?

In general, you may very well approve PRs: it shall be a useful information for mathlib reviewers and maintainers (the later are the only ones that are allowed to merge PRs).

Thanks! (and also thanks Calle for reviewing!)
maintainer merge
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by erdOne.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9363601446/job/25774747622)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9363601446/job/25774747392)

Thanks :tada:

bors merge
Apart from my comments, it all looks good to me. Can I approve it after these changes? Or should I wait for someone more experienced to also review it?
This looks good to me now!

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

```suggestion
    { toFun := M'.map f
```

```suggestion
      map_add' := map_add _
```

```suggestion
induced by a morphism of presheaves of rings `R âŸ¶ R'`. -/
```

```suggestion
induced by a morphism of sheaves of rings `R âŸ¶ R'`. -/
```
I guess this is a very minor comment, but maybe `Î± : R âŸ¶ R'` should also be a variable in this file?
It could be, but the file is very short, and doing so would require making also `M'` a global variable, otherwise the order of the parameters would have to be changed.

```suggestion
```
This line doesn't seem to be strictly necessary, but maybe this is not a good idea because too much burden is placed on `rfl` and I have no idea how efficient that is.
I have used the syntax `dsimp at eq âŠ¢` which also reduces the number of lines of code by `1`!
Should this get `@[simps]`?
Thanks for the suggestion.
Also this.

```suggestion
        erw [(M'.map_smul f (Î±.app _ r) x)]
```
I haven't tested this locally yet, but maybe it's a good idea to have this as a `erw` based on this [thread](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/.60erw.60.20vs.20.60apply.60).
Okay based on the continuation of the discussion, feel free to ignore this
